catalogue_raissonne: Lister 13.c (with signature cut away and block unplugged); Finberg 8 iii
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: female figure in sheer, loose dress standing amid trees near center; in background at L is a portion of a castle or church with wall; a flock of birds flying towards a treetop at R
inscription:
Label

-- in graphite on recto, lower left: [F.8.III], reference to Finberg catalogue
-- label on back of mount: William Weston Gallery, 7 Royal Arcade, Albemarle Street, London W1X 3HD, Stock #496/8
provenance: [William Weston Gallery, London, no. 496/8; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: The Lady with the Rooks
